results.title: Top of the world: taiga, tundra, ice-cap
results.brief_description: Shows the geographical characteristics and types of natural life to be found in the world’s three northern-most regions: Canada, Siberia and Alaska. Outlines the consequences of exploiting the areas resources.

results.title: Tongpan
results.brief_description: This documentary re-enactment made following the 1973 student rebellion which toppled the military junta in Thailand, is based on the experiences of a farmer from the poverty stricken north eastern region. It portrays the political and cultural gap that exists between peasant realities and the good intentions of the intelligentsia. In Thai with English subtitles.

results.title: Tomorrow is another day
results.brief_description: The race for global and spacial dominance asserts itself in the form of armaments and their destructive capabilities. This animated film’s symbolic message poses a frightening problem: Is there hope for peaceful atomic applications or are nations so obsessed with destruction as a token of aggrandisement that the call for peace is merely a mushroom-cloud transparency?

results.title: Tokyo in spring
results.brief_description: A survey of the tourist attractions of Tokyo - the traditional Doll Festival for girls, the tea ceremony and cherry blossom by day and night. Includes types of accommodation for tourists, the public transport system and the spring presentation of the famous Tokyo review.

results.title: To Win at All Costs
results.brief_description: This is an absorbing account of the men, money and boats involved in the glittering social and sporting event that is America’s Cup yacht racing. It tells the fascinating story of the longest winning streak in sport’s history from the first race in 1851 to the highly dramatic and much publicised series of 1983 races held off Newport, Rhode Island. America, defending the coveted trophy for the 25th time, was finally beaten, giving an historic victory to the challenging “Australia II”.

results.title: To warm the world
results.brief_description: Describes the manufacture of Laconia woollen blankets as seen through the eyes of a little girl who cares for her own flock of sheep and wonders what happens to the wool after her sheep are shorn. Shows the fleece being scoured, dyed, carded and spun into yarn; weaving, milling, piece dyeing and mothproofing processes; and the drying, cutting and finishing of each blanket.

results.title: To live and learn
results.brief_description: A film about London schools and school-children, showing the work of infant, junior and secondary schools. The film brings out the development of the children’s own personalities as well as showing teaching methods, and illustrates the wide variety of opportunities in London’s grammar and other secondary schools. Interviews with head teachers and parents are included.
